node.title: The U.S. Air Force dismisses 27 members over vaccine refusals.
node.alt: Joint Base Pearl Harbor-Hickam in Hawaii held a mass Covid-19 vaccination session in February for members of the military.
node.description: They are the first members of a total military force of more than two million believed to be forced out over the shots.
node.content: ["The U.S. Air Force has dismissed 27 service members for refusing to get vaccinated against the coronavirus, the first members of the military believed to be forced out over the shots.", "Since August when the Pentagon began requiring all troops to get the coronavirus vaccine or face dismissal, almost 96 percent of active duty members have had at least one shot; about 74 percent of the 2.1 million people that make up the total force are now fully vaccinated.", "Each service branch has a different deadline for shots, and the Air Force, with more than 325,000 active duty members, was the first to hit the deadline last month. While some military members have chosen to leave rather than be vaccinated, the 27 \u2014 all with less than six years of service \u2014 are the first believed to have been fired, Pentagon officials said. ", "The Defense Department has granted very few exemptions from the mandate, other than to people who were already leaving the military or those who have medical issues. So far, not a single service member has been granted a religious exemption.", "The U.S. military routinely requires members to take vaccines to serve and considers being inoculated against the coronavirus essential for basic readiness.", "Last month, the newly appointed head of the National Guard in Oklahoma said that his troops would not be required to get vaccinated. Lloyd J. Austin III, the secretary of defense, has told Gov. Kevin Stitt that the troops must comply with the requirement for all service branches. This week, the Pentagon released a new order saying that National Guard members who do not get vaccinated would receive a general order of reprimand; essentially ending their career.", "The Pentagon is pondering requiring a booster shot for troops as well."]
